name: Hotel Farnese

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel after reading rave reviews on this site, and because it was ranked the #4 hotel in Rome on TripAdvisor at the time. I was going to be in Italy with my girlfriend for 10 days, and wanted to spend the last night somewhere special, and this looked like it fit the bill perfectly.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It doesn't.
reviews.title: Not Impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a clean, nice hotel, with good staff, but the room we stayed in was very small and dark -- a gloomy room that makes you think of rainy Sundays!!! The bathroom was spacious and modern, which was a bonus -- from the look of the floor layout on the fire escape plans, some of the other rooms are larger but have smaller bathrooms (with only showers). The TV was a portable, without any movies or other features, and the communal room on the ground floor was quite small.
reviews.title: Look Elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's listed as a 4 star hotel, but I think it's no more than an average 3 star. I'd have given the hotel a 3 star review, normally, since, as I said, it's not a BAD hotel, just nothing special. But given some of the other glowing reviews on this site (posted by friends of the owners, mayhaps????), I think it's necessary to balance the scales a bit -- hence the 3 star rating. If you get a good rate, and don't mind being a small room, then it's not a bad hotel and isn't TOO far from the centre. But it's certainly nothing special, and came as quite a letdown for us in the end, based on its high standing on TripAdvisor. For once, the reviews on this site have let us down ...
reviews.title: Just OK...nothing much too expect

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel Farnese expecting a lovely, unique 4 star hotel to make the last night of our holiday special. What we found was a VERY small, dingy room, with little natural light and naf decor. The king bed was 2 singles, pushed together. The only plus was that we had a nice bathroon with a corner bath, although this was not huge either. We considered asking for another room but looked at the floor plan and realised that those that were slightly bigger had tiny bathrooms so there was no real compromise.
reviews.title: Great hotel, couldn't ask for more

reviews.text: What a gem! The Farnese is not located in the center of Rome but rather close to the Vatican and St. Peter's square. For leisure travelers thus it might be a bit inconvenient but I would not exchange the feeling of being at a palace for a more central location! Because that's how you feel at the Farnese: luxury with class and good taste. Everything is brand new but they kept the old-style decorations and furniture. Service is "impecable". The only minor inconvenience is that, in spite of all the sound-proof windows and isolation, those that have sensitive ears may find it a bit noisy after 8am.
reviews.title: Outstanding

likes.liked: — Simple, clean and luxury for the best price. Free Internet access

reviews.title: Excellent place to recharge your batteries
reviews.text: We have just spent 5 wonderful days in Rome. This was our first trip abroad together, to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary and our retirement. Hotel Farnese is a lovely, comfortable place to relax and prepare for the following day's hectic schedule.

reviews.title: Small room, good location
reviews.text: Staff really helpful, nothing too much trouble, and the breakfast buffet was brilliant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Metro station just round corner.
reviews.title: Like meeting a friend from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a triple, and the room was the smallest and shabbiest of the hotels during our trip to Italy. The bathroom is small but otherwise adequate. The cleaning service is attentive. There is no Internet connection available in the room, although there is a station in the lobby area for an extra fee. The streets outside are very quiet. The elevator is very small and painfully slow. We lazy Americans took the stairs up and down to the third floor instead. In terms of amenities, the hotel doesn't really deserve its 4 star designation.
reviews.title: Good Location and Pleasant Staff

reviews.text: Our recent rip to italy started in Rome. we had a pleasnat stay at Hotel Farnese. The beds are comfortable, even the pull out sofa bed that my mother had slept on. breakfast was the best that we had ( we stayed in Florence and Venice also), plenty for our american appetites, scambled eggs, and all the other items were just wonderful. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The area is convenient and nice. We walked some, called for taxis, and walked some more at other times, never a problem. Pizzeria San Marco has excellent food ( not far away) and convenient hours. They also print your bill out computerized -nice
reviews.title: worth the stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay at this small boutique hotel again. They have most of what I expect from a small hotel. Cleanliness, pleasant staff, great breakfast, nice location, honesty
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Quiet part of Rome.

likes.liked: — Good quality rooms and helpful staff.

reviews.text: We stayed very recently at this Hotel and found it to be very good in all respects.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel itself was found to be very clean with good sized rooms and excellent comfortable bedding. There were some very nice touches to the rooms which made you feel at home, with soft slippers and robes available.
reviews.title: Extremely Pleasant Staff but a bit overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is situated very close to the metro system, in a reasonably quiet suburban area of Rome, and therefore you can get to the important parts of the city quickly, especially the Vatican City which you can either take the metro, or it is within walking distance of about 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — the staff at the front desk

reviews.text: We just completed a whirlwind 2 week tour of Italy from Venice to Florence to Rome to Sorrento. This was far and away the best hotel experience we had in Italy. (or anywhere for that matter) All of the raves about the staff are well deserved. They anticipate your needs and actually go out of their way to help at the mear mention of a difficulty of any sort without even being asked. They do this with grace, tact, and always a smile. Just try getting that kind of service any where else. As if the service alone wasn't a good enough reason to stay at the Hotel Farnese, the location was fantastic. Convenient to all of the sites of Rome and yet you'll feel like you are living in a secluded Roman neighborhood, albeit an upscale one. The room was beautiful, immaculate, spacious, richly decorated and authentically furnished. The bathroom was large and perfectly appointed. Everything about the Hotel Farnese exudes class, charm, warmth, romance, and a truely gracious Roman experience. I could go on and on about it but go and see for yourself. I followed the advice of past guests and boy am I glad I did!!..If I am ever lucky enough to go back to Rome, I would not consider staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Don't Hesitate For One Moment....The Best Hotel Experience on Our Whole Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Christensen, Orlando, FL, USA
reviews.title: Not bad, but expensive for facilities.

reviews.text: We had booked 3 nights a t the Capo D'Africa then 3 nights here to get a different perspective of the city. The Capo is bright, modern and close to the Coloseum, this is small, 'oldy-worldly' and 'quaint'.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: If you book here and get room 25 ask to change straight away, it's the smallest room and bathroom I have ever seen. The size of the shower cubicle is a complete joke (I know I tried to use it!) and anyone of more ample proportions would have had immense difficulty in actually moving round the bathroom, it is THAT bad!
reviews.title: Why not? It's a quite neighbourhood hotel with good personable service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is also right next to the lift (which you can hear) and there seemed to be no sound insulation at all from the hallway. For 265 euros a night, disgraceful.
reviews.title: Quiet base for the Eternal City

likes.disliked: — No room safe, although the hotel safe was available.

description: Welcome to the ancient aristocratic residence that today houses Hotel Farnese. A luxury hotel blessed with a soft atmosphere of refined elegance and the efficiency of our friendly personnel. Its owners are pleased to personally welcome guests to the hotel, which has been in service for over 60 years, guaranteeing the courteous service with attention to detail that has come to distinguish Hotel Farnese from the 4 star hotels of Rome.
